message.content: This question requires understanding the concept of nonrenewable resources. Nonrenewable resources, such as coal, are finite and cannot be replaced or replenished at the same rate at which they are being used. Option (A) is incorrect because being nonrenewable means it is not sought after as an alternate energy source, as it is not sustainable in the long term. Option (B) is incorrect because nonrenewable resources cannot be replaced with enough time. Option (D) is incorrect because nonrenewable resources have a limited supply and will eventually run out, causing the industry to cease to exist.

This question requires basic knowledge about nonrenewable resources. Being a nonrenewable resource means that coal cannot be replaced or replenished with enough time. Coal is formed from ancient organic materials over millions of years, and its supply is finite. Option (A) is incorrect because being a nonrenewable resource means that coal is not a sustainable or alternate energy source. Option (B) is incorrect because, as mentioned previously, coal cannot be replaced or replenished. Option (D) is incorrect because, as a nonrenewable resource, coal does not have an unending supply.

This question requires knowledge about the definition of nonrenewable resources. A nonrenewable resource is one that cannot be replaced or replenished within a human lifespan or a relatively short period of time. In the case of coal, it takes millions of years to form, so it is considered to be a nonrenewable resource. Option (A) is incorrect because coal is not sought after as an alternate energy source, but rather as a traditional fossil fuel. Option (B) is incorrect because nonrenewable resources cannot be replaced within a short timeframe. Option (D) is incorrect because nonrenewable resources have a limited supply and will eventually run out.

This question requires basic knowledge about nonrenewable resources. Being a nonrenewable resource means that coal cannot be replaced or replenished with enough time. Once coal is exhausted, it cannot be naturally replenished, which means the industry will eventually have to find alternative sources of energy. Option (A) is incorrect because being a nonrenewable resource does not make coal highly sought after as an alternate energy source. Option (B) is incorrect because being nonrenewable means it cannot be replaced. Option (D) is incorrect because being nonrenewable means there is a limited supply of coal.

This question requires an understanding of the meaning of the term "nonrenewable resource." A nonrenewable resource, such as coal, refers to a resource that cannot be replaced or replenished within a human lifespan or at a rate that is sustainable for future generations. Therefore, option (C) is correct because if coal is a nonrenewable resource, the industry will eventually cease to exist once all the coal has been extracted. Option (A) is incorrect because being a nonrenewable resource does not necessarily mean it is highly sought after as an alternate energy source. Option (B) is incorrect because if a resource is nonrenewable, it cannot be replaced or replenished with enough time. Option (D) is incorrect because a nonrenewable resource has a limited supply and is not unending.
